results.deck: Rocketbirds 2: Evolution is being developed by Ratloop Asia and is the sequel to Rocketbirds: Hardboiled Chicken.
results.name: Rocketbirds 2: Evolution

results.deck: Action-RPG from NostalgiCO, successfully kickstarted on February 26, 2013. ATLUS will be publishing the game in Summer 2016.
results.name: Cryamore

results.deck: A sequel to the first Blood Bowl. A game based on the Games Workshop table top mini figures game of the same name that pits fantasy races from the Warhammer universe against one another in turn-based American football.
results.name: Blood Bowl 2

results.deck: Despite the name, this is the third entry in the Anomaly series of "tower offense" games.
results.name: Anomaly 2

results.deck: An ordinary mercenary is possessed by a fire demon, who just might grant the power to save the world from a massive army of the undead, in this fantasy action-RPG by French developer Spiders.
results.name: Bound By Flame

results.deck: A remake of the SNES platformer for virtually every active platform.
results.name: Putty Squad

results.deck: In Sniper Elite III, players once again take on the role of World War II sniper Karl Fairburne, this time as he travels to Northern Africa to uncover a secret Nazi plot.
results.name: Sniper Elite III

results.deck: 1-4 player Tactical Arena Co-Op game, funded via Kickstarter.
results.name: Forced

results.deck: A platformer that takes inspiration from both Super Hexagon and Super Meat Boy. The game tasks players with ending the tyrannical rule of the Groove-Wizard.
results.name: Electronic Super Joy

results.deck: Rack N Ruin is a top-down adventure game featuring hand-drawn art that puts the player in the role of a demon attempting to corrupt entire planets.
results.name: Rack N Ruin

results.deck: A procedurally generated roguelike action game developed by Vlambeer. After creating a prototype called Wasteland Kings for Mojam 2, Vlambeer took the prototype and renamed it Nuclear Throne.
results.name: Nuclear Throne

results.deck: A 2D sidescroller with elements of both roguelikes and Castlevania-style games.
results.name: Chasm

results.deck: A science fiction-themed action-RPG by Supergiant Games, creators of Bastion.
results.name: Transistor

results.deck: A collection for PS3, PS4, Vita and PC, containing Final Fantasy X International and Final Fantasy X-2 International + Last Mission featuring HD visuals and a remastered soundtrack.
results.name: Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD Remaster

results.deck: A co-op puzzle-platformer starring four tiny superpowered mammals. Players can switch between characters, using each one's unique abilities to solve challenges posed by their mad scientist creator.
results.name: Tiny Brains

results.deck: Renegade Kid's new episodic Horror-FPS originally planned for the Nintendo 3DS eShop. On April 2, 2014 Renegade Kid announced the game was evolved into a console game and went to Kickstarter while the 3DS version has been canceled. The game will be made even if the Kickstarter fails but it will take a lot longer, according to Renegade Kid.
results.name: Cult County

results.deck: An action-platformer paying homage to 8-bit classics like Mega Man and Castlevania. It is developed by a small group of former WayForward employees, with funding through Kickstarter.
results.name: Shovel Knight

results.deck: Secret Ponchos is a downloadable, competitive twin-stick shooter focused on skill-based combat and its unique cast of Spaghetti-western inspired characters.
results.name: Secret Ponchos

results.deck: An episodic, single-player spinoff of the dinosaur-heavy multiplayer shooter, coming to PCs and the PlayStation 4.
results.name: Primal Carnage: Genesis

results.deck: When Earthbound meets Little King's Story, you get Citizens of Earth. An RPG in which the player inhabits the Vice President of Earth who has to recruit citizens that fight battles for him. The game was published by ATLUS.
results.name: Citizens of Earth

results.deck: A PlayStation Vita exclusive puzzle platformer where the game world is made out of infographics representing statistics about the player's current gameplay session.
results.name: Metrico

results.deck: Defend the dungeon in Dungeon Defenders 2. There are several new game modes including a DotA type mode.
results.name: Dungeon Defenders II

results.deck: 5 Star Wrestling from Serious Parody is a wrestling game that features nearly 200 moves per wrestler.
results.name: 5 Star Wrestling

results.deck: A zombified parody of The Oregon Trail, swapping Western pioneers with survivors of a zombie apocalypse. Expanded off the original browser game, the director's cut boasts new challenges and significant changes to the original gameplay.
results.name: Organ Trail: Director's Cut

results.deck: An upcoming turn-based RPG from AckkStudios.
results.name: YIIK: A Postmodern RPG

results.deck: A sequel to the 2011 WiiWare sidescrolling action game, funded through Kickstarter. Now it's a 3D Action RPG.
results.name: Anima - Gate of Memories

results.deck: A multiplayer-only resurrection of the TimeSplitters franchise featuring maps, weapons, and characters that you have come to know and love.
results.name: TimeSplitters Rewind

results.deck: Swimsanity is a four-player, underwater brawler.
results.name: Swimsanity

results.deck: Race the Sun puts players in a solar-powered aircraft that must avoid obstacles at increasing speeds in an attempt to stay airborne as long as possible in a race against the setting sun. Supports the Oculus Rift for PC.
results.name: Race the Sun

results.deck: A fast-paced shooter with some rogue-like elements. It is developed mostly by Joe Mirabello, an ex-employee of 38 Studios.
results.name: Tower of Guns

results.deck: Super Mega Baseball is a arcade-style simulation baseball game from Metalhead Software.
results.name: Super Mega Baseball

results.deck: A tough-as-nails, retro-styled action game published by Adult Swim.
results.name: Volgarr the Viking

results.deck: Trace a safe route to help a ninja squirrel pick up power-ups and avoid enemies in a modern Pac-Man.
results.name: Nutjitsu

results.deck: A touch-based side-scrolling platformer.
results.name: Badland

results.deck: A non-combat and non-competitive multiplayer for PC, Mac, Linux, and PlayStation 4.
results.name: Wander

results.deck: The 2014 installment in EA Canada's soccer simulation franchise. This was the first in the franchise to bridge the 360/PS3 to Xbox One/PS4 gap.
results.name: FIFA 14

results.deck: A tennis-themed, physics-based puzzle game by 10tons.
results.name: Tennis in the Face

results.deck: Fight for the survival of mankind against the armies of Hell.
results.name: Hellraid

results.deck: Risk of Rain is an action sidescroller that has players exploring an alien planet, using random upgrades to build your character and push further in to the hostile landscape.
results.name: Risk of Rain

results.deck: The latest entry in the venerable shooter franchise takes place in a version of the 1960s in which the Nazis have established a global empire after winning World War II. Protagonist B.J. Blazkowicz fights for an underground resistance movement, outnumbered and outgunned by high-tech Nazi forces.
results.name: Wolfenstein: The New Order

results.deck: A cross-gen open-world driving game set in a fictional Redview County.
results.name: Need for Speed Rivals

results.deck: 2D side-scrolling action game in the vein of Flashback, with a 50s/60s Cold War setting.
results.name: CounterSpy

results.deck: A colorful and surreal 2D adventure game where the player controls a flying, snake-like character, finding ways to interact with other characters and objects in each of 17 stages.
results.name: Hohokum

results.deck: "RPG/Simulation/Interactive Story" with a large universe to explore and a significant social component.
results.name: Doki-Doki Universe

results.deck: A stop motion, point-and-click adventure comedy game by Doug TenNapel, Mike Dietz, and Ed Schofield; with music by Terry Scott Taylor.
results.name: Armikrog

results.deck: Road Redemption is a Kickstarter-funded spiritual sequel to Road Rash. Motorcycle-combat-racing for a new generation.
results.name: Road Redemption

results.deck: Legendary, quick-witted swordsman Lo Wang returns to fight demonic forces in this total re-imagining of 3D Realms's 1997 Asian-themed first-person shooter of the same name.
results.name: Shadow Warrior

results.deck: Earthlock: Festival of Magic is an episodic RPG adventure with harvesting and crafting along with PVP mechanics.
results.name: Earthlock: Festival Of Magic

results.deck: The fifteenth installment of 2K Sports' basketball sim arrives just in time for the 2013-14 NBA season.
results.name: NBA 2K14

results.deck: An entry in the Nobunaga's Ambition franchise for the PS3 and PC, timed to celebrate the thirtieth anniversary of the series.
results.name: Nobunaga's Ambition: Sphere of Influence

results.deck: An indie action game for PC, Mac, and Linux that melds fast-paced first-person shooting with the random levels and permanent death of roguelikes.
results.name: Paranautical Activity

results.deck: A retro-style 2D skateboarding game inspired by the Tony Hawk franchise.
results.name: OlliOlli

results.deck: A fantasy action-RPG developed by CI Games and Deck 13 for PC, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One. The protagonist, convicted and ostracized for his crimes by a draconian society, is called upon to stop an army of demons commanded by a god who was long ago overthrown.
results.name: Lords of the Fallen

results.deck: The 5th installment in the Guilty Gear franchise. It is the first in the Xrd series and is directed by Guilty Gear Creator Daisuke Ishiwatari.
results.name: Guilty Gear Xrd -SIGN-

results.deck: UFC comes to next-gen platforms via EA SPORTS.
results.name: EA Sports UFC

results.deck: Dying Light is a first-person, open world game set in a zombie apocalypse. The player character is able to free-run to get around the environment quickly.
results.name: Dying Light

results.deck: N++ is billed as the final iteration of the N franchise by Metanet software starring a Ninja that needs Gold to survive. It is a minimal & challenging momentum-based platformer featuring co-op, user level creation and boasts over 2300 levels.
results.name: N++

results.deck: An action role playing game.
results.name: Second Chance Heroes

results.deck: Wonder Flick is a treasure-hunting RPG from Level-5 for iOS and Android.
results.name: Wonder Flick

results.deck: Billed as "a genealogical Rogue-lite", Rogue Legacy is an indie 2D side-scrolling mash-up of Metroidvania platforming and Rougelike perma-death, as players build up a knight's lineage by exploring the procedurally-generated Castle Hamson while collecting gold, attempting to defeat bosses, and dying (many times, with each death bringing forth a new descendent).
results.name: Rogue Legacy

results.deck: Platforming adventure about Ray, who awakens from a coma with a 16 foot pink spaghetti arm sticking out of his head and discovers that The Man is literally out to get him.
results.name: Stick It to the Man!

results.deck: An archery-based platform fighting game inspired by Smash Bros. and Bushido Blade.
results.name: TowerFall

results.deck: PlayStation 4 exclusive from Bloober Team.
results.name: Basement Crawl

results.deck: EA's revival of the NBA Live series that followed several years of cancellations and false starts. It was released exclusively on the new generation of PlayStation 4 and Xbox One hardware.
results.name: NBA Live 14

results.deck: An enhanced version of the first person puzzle game, Q.U.B.E., for PC, PS3, Wii U and Xbox One with an all-new story, new puzzles and a new Time Trial mode.
results.name: Q.U.B.E. Director's Cut

results.deck: Visual novel by Giga.
results.name: Hotch Kiss

results.deck: Plants and Zombies are once again pitted against each other in this class-based third-person shooter developed by Popcap Games.
results.name: Plants vs. Zombies: Garden Warfare

results.deck: The new title in Ubisoft's hugely successful dance game franchise.
results.name: Just Dance 2014

results.deck: The long-awaited sequel to Peggle from PopCap.
results.name: Peggle 2

results.deck: The follow-up to the Battlefront games of the PS2/Xbox era. Now being developed by DICE and published by EA.
results.name: Star Wars Battlefront

results.deck: The second edition of Rocksmith from Ubisoft features a new soundtrack, enhancements to the user interface, and a slew of new games and lessons aimed at helping learn how to play the guitar.
results.name: Rocksmith 2014

results.deck: A single-player and cooperative driving game that takes place throughout the United States, developed by Ivory Tower.
results.name: The Crew

results.deck: RedLynx takes their bike-platforming franchise to the future (and PlayStation) with the addition of a physics-based trick system.
results.name: Trials Fusion

results.deck: An online-only open-world shooter-RPG from Ubisoft Massive set in a chaotic New York City that is wrought by disease.
results.name: Tom Clancy's The Division

results.deck: A third-person shooter set in a steampunk-themed alternate timeline, with a dash of the supernatural. Developed by Ready at Dawn Studios for the PlayStation 4.
results.name: The Order: 1886

results.deck: Galak-Z is a sci-fi roguelike space shooter inspired by anime of the 1970s and '80s.
results.name: Galak-Z: The Dimensional

results.deck: The third sequentially numbered title in the Kingdom Hearts franchise; it was revealed during the 2013 Sony E3 press conference.
results.name: Kingdom Hearts III

results.deck: An open world action game with an emphasis on vehicular combat, based on the Mad Max character from the series of Australian post-apocalyptic films by George Miller.
results.name: Mad Max

results.deck: A persistent MMORPG set in the Warhammer 40k Universe and developed by Behaviour Interactive.
results.name: Warhammer 40,000: Eternal Crusade

results.deck: H-Hour: World's Elite is a tactical, team-focused multiplayer shooter, envisioned as a spiritual successor to SOCOM. The game's Kickstarter campaign was funded successfully, and it is slated for release in 2015.
results.name: H-Hour: World's Elite

results.deck: Liege is a party-based, tactical role-playing game for PC, Mac, iOS and Android. The game takes the classic JRPG formula and layer in a mature story, tactical gameplay and hand-drawn visuals.
results.name: Liege

results.deck: A love letter to J-RPG classics from the Playstation era like Final Fantasy, Breath of Fire, Suikoden, and Persona.
results.name: Soul Saga

results.deck: A spy and espionage themed turn-based tactics game from Klei Entertainment.
results.name: Invisible, Inc.

results.deck: The third major installment of the Street Fighter IV legacy adds characters and stages from Street Fighter X Tekken, a brand new fighter, new gameplay mechanics (including the ability to bring both Ultra Combos into the fight), and a variety of balance tweaks, training enhancements, and new modes.
results.name: Ultra Street Fighter IV

results.deck: The fifth main entry in the Disgaea franchise.
results.name: Disgaea 5: Alliance of Vengeance

results.deck: An Action Adventure game based on The LEGO Movie and developed in the style of other TT Games' LEGO videogames.
results.name: The LEGO Movie Videogame

results.deck: Strider Hiryu must assassinate Grandmaster Meio in this action-adventure game from Double Helix and Capcom.
results.name: Strider

results.deck: A tarot card driven roguelike action role playing game, by Defiant Development from Brisbane, Australia.
results.name: Hand of Fate

results.deck: Bridge Constructor is a game in which bridges must be built.
results.name: Bridge Constructor

results.deck: Outed by her own government as a legendary spy, Alyssa must dodge adoring fans and dangerous villains to save the world one more time.
results.name: Cosmic Star Heroine

results.deck: From Retro/Grade developer, Matt Gilgenbach, Neverending Nightmares is a psychological horror game heavily inspired by the designer's experiences with mental illness.
results.name: Neverending Nightmares

results.deck: A ridiculously violent platform shooter game about being action heroes from the '80s, '90s and 00's.
results.name: Broforce

results.deck: A hand-drawn, puzzle platformer about a goat imprisoned for witchcraft.
results.name: Escape Goat 2

results.deck: A free-to-play sandbox game by SOE in which players can use detailed editing tools to create items, structures, and worlds in collaboration with thousands of other players. The game started as an EverQuest side project, and some user-created content will carry over to EverQuest Next.
results.name: Landmark

results.deck: How to Survive is an isometric zombie survival game with hunger mechanics, RPG stat mechanics, crafting and multiple playable characters along with local and online multiplayer options.
results.name: How to Survive

results.deck: SteamWorld Dig is a platforming mining adventure. Old steambot Rusty arrives in a mining town and starts digging his way through the earth below to find riches and eliminate an ancient threat coming from below.
results.name: SteamWorld Dig

results.deck: Kickstarter funded turn based Strategy game inspired by classics such as Battle Isle, Advance Wars, and Panzer General developed by KING Art Games.
results.name: Battle Worlds: Kronos

results.deck: A puzzle game by Swing Swing Submarine.
results.name: Tetrobot and Co.

results.deck: Volume is a stealth game by Thomas Was Alone designer, Mike Bithell.
results.name: Volume

results.deck: Aaru's Awakening is a hand-drawn, 2D, action platformer by Lumenox Games.
results.name: Aaru's Awakening
